snippet: Santonio Holmes of the Jets and Scottie Pippen of the Bulls are among those who have endured criticism for bad behavior during games.
abstract: Santonio Holmes of the Jets and Scottie Pippen of the Bulls are among those who have endured criticism for bad behavior during games.
lead_paragraph: When Santonio Holmes of the Jets appeared to quit on the team in a loss to the Dolphins Sunday, a number of teammates went public with their criticism. But it wasn't the first time in recent sports history that a player was in the spotlight for not being a team-first guy. Jorge Posada of the Yankees took himself out of the lineup in May when Manager Joe Girardi tried to bat him ninth in the lineup against the Red Sox. And in 1994 Scottie Pippen of the Bulls refused to play when Coach Phil Jackson designed a scoring play for his teammate Toni Kukoc.

headline.main: From Pippen to Holmes: Is There a Penalty for Quitting on a Team?
